Package chess

Class Chess

java.lang.Object
chess.Chess
public class Chess
extends java.lang.Object
The Chess class contains the main method, and handles the logic for the chess game such as reading user input, keeping track of and printing turns, printing board, displaying if move is invalid, draw, resign, check, CheckMate along with displaying who the winner of the game is.
Since:
2022-03-22
Version:
1.0
Author:
Afaq Qamar (aq101), Suryateja Gandhesiri (sg1571)

  • Field Details

    • turnCount

      public static int turnCount
      The turnCount variable tracks the move number the game is currently on. Each time player turn switches, turnCount increments. true is white's turn, 2 is blacks move.

    • testMove

      public static boolean testMove
      The testMove variable tracks whether the sequence of code is testing for hypothetical scenarios on the board. This ensures that during test moves, flags such as castling or enPassant aren't wrongly changed.

  • Constructor Details

    • Chess

      public Chess()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      The main method. Initializes board, prints board, takes user input, moves if valid input, displays if invalid input, handles draw, handles resign, handles check and check mate.
      Parameters:
      args - The command line arguments.

    • printTurn

      public static java.lang.String printTurn()
      This method prints which team's turn it is.
      Returns:
      String The method returns "White's move: " or "Black's Move: " based on the turn

    • changeTurn

      public static void changeTurn()
      Helper method to assist with changing the turns If turn is one, change to two and wise versa

    • resign

      public static java.lang.String resign()
      The resign method declares other team as winner
      Returns:
      String It will display "Black Wins" or "White Wins"

    • validCoords

      public static boolean validCoords​(int[] oldPosConv, int[] newPosConv)
      This method checks if the user enters valid coordinates to move the piece The coordinates must be on the board, and the starting spot must contain a piece of the current team.
      Parameters:
      oldPosConv - First param will take in the old position coordinates as an array
      newPosConv - First param will take in the new position coordinates as an array
      Returns:
      boolean returns true if the coordinates are valid, false if they are not

    • findKing

      public static int[] findKing​(Piece[][] board, boolean team)
      This method find the coordinates of the King piece of specified team on specified board It takes in a boolean of the team type true = white false = black
      Parameters:
      board - First param is the board itself. It can either be main board, or a test board
      team - Second param takes in what team King you want: true = white false = black
      Returns:
      int[] returns the coordinates of King

    • convertBack

      public static java.lang.String convertBack​(int[] coords)
      ConvertBack takes in the int[] coords and converts it back into a string so the isCheck method can pass it into isValidMove
      Parameters:
      coords - First param that takes in the int array cords
      Returns:
      String Returns the string version of integer cords

    • WhiteInCheck

      public static boolean WhiteInCheck()
      WhiteInCheck method checks if the white king is in check by any black pieces. It gets the kings location through findKing method and tests if any black piece has a valid move to the king.
      Returns:
      boolean Returns true if king is in check, and false otherwise.

    • WhiteInCheck

      public static boolean WhiteInCheck​(Piece[][] board)
      This method checks if a White King is in check in the hypothetical copy board
      Parameters:
      board - The copied chess board
      Returns:
      boolean True if the white king is in check, False otherwise

    • BlackInCheck

      public static boolean BlackInCheck()
      BlackInCheck method checks if the black king is in check by any white pieces. It gets the kings location through findKing method and tests if any white piece has a valid move to the king.
      Returns:
      boolean Returns true if king is in check, and false otherwise.

    • BlackInCheck

      public static boolean BlackInCheck​(Piece[][] board)
      This method checks if a Black King is in check in the hypothetical copy board
      Parameters:
      board - The copied chess board
      Returns:
      boolean True if the black king is in check, False otherwise

    • anyMovesLeft

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> anyMovesLeft​(boolean team)
      This method checks if the current team has any moves left when in check. It stores all valid moves any piece on the team can do that take the king out of check, and stores them in the validMoves arrayList
      Parameters:
      team - True if White, False otherwise
      Returns:
      Returns an ArrayList filled with all the possible moves that take team out of check

    • selfCheck

      public static boolean selfCheck​(java.lang.String start, java.lang.String end)
      This method checks if a move the team is attempting will put it's own King in check
      Parameters:
      start - The starting position of the piece
      end - The ending position of the piece
      Returns:
      boolean True if the move puts it's own king in check, False otherwise

    • copyArray

      public static Piece[][] copyArray()
      This method makes a copy of the 2D board array to be used for hypothetical tests
      Returns:
      Piece[][] Returns a 2D array of type Piece (copy of the Board)
